page.title: 10POTTERY, WENFORD BRIDGE
page.content: TODAY THE POTTERY IS OWNED BY THE CARDEW FAMILY WHO ARE VERY EXPERIENCED IN LOTS OF ARTS AND CRAFTS. MICHAEL CARDEW,WHO IS NOW DEAD,WAS THE FIRST STUDENT OF BERNARD LEACH, THE WORLD FAMOUS POTTER WHO WORKED IN ST.IVES. MICHAEL CARDEW LIVED IN NORTH AFRICA FOR A WHILE AND WAS INSPIRED BY NORTH AFRICAN POTTERY. HIS SON SETH AND GRANDSON ARRA NOW DIG THEIR OWN CLAY FROM LOCAL SOIL. THEY USE THIS CLAY TO MAKE THEIR OWN POTTERY WHICH IS MAINLY STONEWARE. THE DECORATIONS AND DESIGNS THEY PAINT ON THE POTTERY ARE BASED ON NORTH AFRICAN DESIGNS WHICH INSPIRED MICHAEL CARDEW WHEN HE WAS LIVING IN NORTH AFRICA AND THEY STILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THESE IDEAS. PEOPLE COME FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD TO SEE THE POTTERY.
